(Simplified: 蓟)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 魝 indicates the sound; 艹 (plant) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 魝 [ jié ]
①多年生草本植物，花紫色，可入藥，亦稱“大薊”。
薊城 [ jì chéng ]: old name for Beijing 北京
薊縣 [ jì xiàn ]: Ji county in Tianjin 天津
薊馬 [ jì mǎ ]: (zoology) thrips (order Thysanoptera); thunderbug

薊字的基本解释

薊
jì
见“蓟”。

薊字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jì］
［《廣韻》古詣切，去霽，見。］
“蓟1”的繁体字。亦作“葪1”。
(1)多年生草本植物。有大蓟、小蓟两种。大蓟茎高四五尺，小蓟茎高仅尺馀。全草可供药用，嫩叶和茎皆可食，亦可作饲料。
(2)古地名。在今北京城西南隅。周武王克商，封尧之后于此。
(3)姓。汉有蓟子训。见《後汉书·方术传下》。

薊字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　薊； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1060第24
【唐韻】古誼切【集韻】【正韻】吉詣切，?音計。【說文】芺也。【爾雅·釋草】芺，薊。【疏】薊生山中者名朮，其生平地而肥大於衆者名楊枹薊，今呼爲馬薊。　又地名。【禮·樂記】封黃帝之後于薊。【註】今涿郡薊縣。　又姓。【神仙傳】薊子訓，齊人。　【五經文字】从角者譌。葪。

thistle
Basic explanation of words
thistle
jì
See "Thistle".
thistle
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jì］
["Guangyun" ancient legends cut, go to Ji, see. ]
The traditional characters of "Thistle 1". Also known as "葪1".
(1) Perennial herb. There are two kinds of thistle and small thistle. The stems of thistle are four to five feet high, and the stems of the small thistle are only a few feet high. The whole plant can be used for medicinal purposes, and the tender leaves and stems are edible and can also be used as feed.
(2) Ancient place names. In the southwest corner of today's Beijing city. The king of Zhou Wu deprived him of business, and he was here after Feng Yao.
(3) Last name. Han has thistle training. See "The Book of the Later Han · Fang Shu Chuan".
thistle
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Characters] 　 Thistle; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 1060 Page 24
[Tang Yun] Gu Yi cut [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Quijo cut, sound meter. [Said the text] Qian Ye. 【Erya·Shuicao】芺, thistle. 【Sparse】Those who live in the mountain are called Yang Yang thistle, and those who are fatter than the others are called Yang Yang thistle. Now it is called horse thistle.　Also place name. [Li·Le Ji] Yu Ji after Feng Huangdi. [Note] This is Jixian, Zhuo County.　Another last name. [God's Biography] Jizixun, Qi people.　【Five Scriptures】From the angle to the Jia.葪.
